Dr Pualani stresses that "chants are a way of gathering data" speaking at high-level dialogue on Spirituality and Conservation #IUCNcongress

"Ceremony establishes a relationship with persons, with your deities as well as with places" spiritual education w/Dr Pualani #IUCNcongress

Strong and admirable statements from Prof Syamsuddin pushing for a "Theology of Conservation" #IUCNcongress

We need a paradigm shift in theology from conservative dogmatism to a more progressive theology - Prof Syamsuddin suggests #IUCNcongress
Nature is sacred, it has its own spirit, its own soul, like a human being - food for thought from Prof Syamsuddin at #IUCNcongress

Rev Harris leaves on a suggestive note, pleading that the structure of conservation funding be re-evaluated for longer-term #IUCNcongress

Rev Harris likens working on conservation to the feeling of "sitting at the bedside of a dying friend - I'm just there" #IUCNcongress

We have seen an extraordinary change in the global Christian church - Rev Harris #IUCNcongress

Mrs Saionji wraps up positively "I feel an awakening of the consciousness, it has started right here in this room right now" #IUCNcongress
